sentences.en: Confidant: One to whom secrets or private matters are disclosed.
sentences.cn: 知己: 能向其倾吐秘密或私事的密友.

sentences.en: He is a close confidant of the president.
He resigned himself to the role of confidant.
sentences.cn: 他退居到知心朋友的地位上.

sentences.en: He was their adviser, confidant and father confessor.
sentences.cn: 他是他们的顾问、密友和倾听者。

sentences.en: If you cannot trust your confidant , he shouldn't be your confidant.
sentences.cn: 如果你不能信任你的知己密友 ﹐ 他就不是你的知己密友.

sentences.en: Indicating knowledge of personal details that only a close confidant could have.
sentences.cn: 表示了解只有关系亲密的人才能知道的个人琐碎私事.

sentences.en: It is an eternal good friend, sister and confidant to young girls.
sentences.cn: 她将成为青春女孩一直寻觅的好友 、 姐姐和知己.

sentences.en: It was Bea Sorenson who was really her confidant.
sentences.cn: 比阿?索伦森才真正是她的知心朋友.

sentences.en: Major Pendennis became the Begum's confidant and house friend.
sentences.cn: 潘登尼斯少校成了贝衮的心腹和家中的亲密朋友.

sentences.en: She is a confidant of mine.
sentences.cn: 她是一位我的知心好友.

sentences.en: She is my confidant ( intimate friend ).
She made George her confidant , professing to find in him a kindred spirit.
sentences.cn: 她使乔治成了自己的密友, 并宣称发现他是个与自己志同道合、趣味相投的人.

sentences.en: She unbosomed her secret to her confidant.
sentences.cn: 她向知己吐露自己的秘密.

sentences.en: She was quite confident that her confidant would keep her secret.
sentences.cn: 她深信她的心腹之交会替她保守秘密.

sentences.en: What in the world ? What does your confidant take me for?
sentences.cn: 在世界上你可否认为我是你的同伴?

trans.tran_en: someone you tell your secrets to or who you talk to about personal things
